intro: Clermontia pallida, commonly known as the pale clermonthe, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Clermontia pallida is considered endangered due to habitat loss and invasive species.
